history.content:
For any student who entered after Fall 2015 only CS61A, CS61B, and CS70 are taken into consideration for admission into the major. So those are the only courses you need in order to declare.

The rest are general lower division requirements.

-------------------

The change to allowing EE16A and 16B to declare the major is probable, but hasn't been approved yet, afaik (@3372).

-------------------

the ee16a/b change is not to declare. The top response is correct, in order to declare, you only need 61a, b, and 70. But to finish your lower division requirements, there  will probably be the 16b instead of 54 change.

The rest are general lower division requirements.

-------------------

children.subject:
Yeah, but CS61A, CS61B and CS70are the only ones taken into consideration of GPA calculation.

Does it mean these are the only courses needed for declaring the major?

I just want to make sure.

history.content:
You should take EE16A instead of Math 54. 

---------------------------------------------------------

Though neither 16A nor Math 54 is required before declaration.

See Steven's answer below.
You should take EE16A instead of Math 54.

I am currently an intended-CS student.

In order to declare the LS CS major, what are all the courses we need?

I saw in the major declaration form that we need Math1A,B,54,CS61A,B,CS70.

However, it has come to my realisation that we only need 2 courses from EE16A,16B and Math 54 to finish the CS degree.

So IN ORDER TO DECLARE THE MAJOR, is it required that we take Math 54 at LS?
history.subject: Math54 needed for declaring LS CS major?
